lead_paragraph: Nearly a year after French troops were accused of abusing boys while on a United Nations mission in the Central African Republic, no one has been charged, let alone punished.

headline.print_headline: Keeping the Peace, but Accused of Abuse
headline.main: Allegations Against French Peacekeepers Highlight Obstacles in Addressing Abuse

snippet: Nearly a year after French troops were accused of abusing boys while on a United Nations mission in the Central African Republic, no one has been charged, let alone punished.
abstract: Memo From the United Nations; internal audit by United Nations Office of Internal Oversight sheds light on issue of rape and child sexual abuse allegations against peacekeepers; highlights problems including bureaucracy, UN's lack of authority to prosecute soldiers, and fact that most common punishment for sex offenses is to return soldiers to home countries and bar them from future missions.
